title: Bacterial operon boundary detector
description: This feature detects intergenic regions at bacterial operon boundaries, particularly at transitions between functionally related gene clusters. It activates at the junctions between genes in important operons including cell division (mur/fts genes), energy metabolism (nuo genes), flagellar biosynthesis (flg/flh genes), and membrane biogenesis (lpx genes). The activation pattern manifests as sharp spikes rather than broad regions, suggesting detection of specific regulatory elements like promoters or terminators that define operon structure. The feature is highly consistent across diverse bacterial phyla including Proteobacteria, Spirochaetes, and Dictyoglomi, indicating it captures a fundamental aspect of bacterial genome organization related to transcriptional regulation of polycistronic mRNAs.
